reviews.title: Very charming hotel and extremely friendly staff
reviews.text: Hotel des Grands Hommes is a small hotel (about 30 rooms) at the Place du Pantheon. Walking distance from Jardin du Luxembourg, Notre Dame, etc.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is very friendly and speaks -if you like- fluently English. The rooms are clean and spacious (of course, remember that you are in Paris).
reviews.title: lives up to the reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The bathroom is not very 'grand', but sufficient.
reviews.title: Bravo for the Grands Hommes !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast can be served on the room without additional charge.
reviews.title: Lovely Boutique

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008
reviews.text: Recommended!
reviews.title: loved Hotel Des Grands Hommes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: I got a non-refundable early reservation rate on the hotel's website, and that was about 35% below full fare. On top of that, they upgraded me from a standard room to a superior one, for no apparent reason: I didn't ask for it and they didn't mention it. So I ended up with a truly good deal: 158 EUR/night for a superior room with a balcony, instead of 310 EUR full fare. The balcony was great for having breakfast.
reviews.title: A nice stay, and good deals to be made

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Given my experience and the phone conversations I overheard at the front desk, it sounds they're very flexible about prices and upgrades.
reviews.title: Wonderful honeymoon at Hotel des Grands Hommes

likes.disliked: — it is at the top of a hill

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is perfect -- just on the Place du Panthéon, a very nice looking plaza.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel
Parisian style at Hotel des Grandes Hommes
reviews.text: Wake-up calls were not reliable: in just 4 days, the staff messed up two of them! The first time, the receptionist apologized. The second time, with another receptionist, I don't think they even realized the problem. Bottom line: bring an alarm clock.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Phone calls are outrageously priced, even for toll-free numbers! Avoid by all means (free wifi: use Skype).
reviews.title: Expensive 3* but worth every cent !
Promide a lot but didn't deliver
reviews.text: This hotel promised a lot, but didn't really deliver. The expected views of the Pantheon and romantic balconies did not eventuate. The reception from staff was very professinal and pleasant but getting to our room from the lift was not so easy. A huge trolley with linen was parked outside the lift door and we were unable to get our suitcase past. This necessitated lifting the heavy suitrcase over the trolley as we could not move it. The room itself was delightfully furnished and the very comfortable bed had lovely linen. However as usual in Paris, space was at a premium. There was nowhere in the room to open 2 suitcases so we had to put one in the bathroom. And the view over the shabby internal courtyard was particularly uninspiring. So our final night in Paris had none of the romance I expected, and certainly no views of the Pantheon.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The breakfast room (a vaulted cellar) was charming but cramped and claustrophobic. We were lucky in finding a table but others were not. The hot water urn was boiling and releasing its steam into this very small space. We should have gone out for breakfast.
reviews.title: Amazing location, beautiful rooms and friendly - a real star find
loved the Grands Hommes
reviews.text: Usually we stay in 2 star hotels in Paris. This was our first foray into a 3 star, as a treat for our final night. Unfortunately not value for money. The other hotel we stayed in, the Hotel de Nice on the Rue de Rivoli was adequate in terms of facilties, cheaper and full of eclectic French charm. And the money saved could be used on a nice meal in the Marais.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Both my friend and I have been to Paris many times and found Hotel des Grands Hommes to be an absolutely amazing star find and without doubt the best hotel for its money in the whole of Paris. The rooms were beautifully decorated and impecably clean. The staff were so friendly and helpful and you could not wish for a better location, it is honestly just a dozen steps away from the Pantheon, no lie!
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel

likes.liked: — The decor in the room was breath-taking!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed for four days in a top floor suite...with a terrific view of Paris from the terrace facing the Pantheon. The room was an excellent choice. Consulted frequently with the front desk staff and was always given prompt, courteous and very helpful assistance. Hotel was conveniently located for either the Metro or for walking to destinations on either side of the Seine. We never used a taxi during our stay.
reviews.title: A Very Pleasant Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oh tripadvisor, you've done it again! After a number of catastrophic, dirty, stinky Paris hotels, I spent an hour researching Tripadvisors top tips, and then booked my holiday on Expedia.
reviews.title: Best hotel I've stayed in in Paris

likes.disliked: — slightly snotty girl on reception one day

reviews.title: Lovely
reviews.text: The hotel was dead cute. Very small room, and even smaller bathroom, but all perfectly formed, with really OTT '19th century' style decor - that was so extreme it was endearing. The area is fantastic, accross from the Pantheon and around the corner from the market of Rue de Mouffetard.

reviews.title: great little hotel
reviews.text: The price was really reasonable, but there was some confusion with paying - I thought I had paid in advance on expedia, but the payment didn't seem to go through. Probably best to book direct with the hotel rather than expedia, as they say they'll beat any internet price anyway...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel des Grands Hommes for four nights. The location of the hotel was perfect for us. As it is close to the Luxembourgh RER-station it is very convenient and easy to reach from CDG Airport. The surrounding area is safe, peaceful and charming with nice restaurants and streets. The service in the hotel was friendly and the athmosphere warm and welcoming. The standard double room was quite small but so French and the bathroom was big and charming. You can really feel that you are in Paris! K & A Helsinki Finland
reviews.title: Perfect in every way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: my husband and i and 2 friends are just back from our stay at this hotel and it was great.firstly,what a great location, right at the pantheon,our friends had a room at the front of the hotel overlooking
reviews.title: Great Location

likes.liked: — Location and view of the Pantheon
likes.disliked: — Poor Quality of Patisserie for Breakfast. We could hear the noise from the street in our room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our first stay in Paris and we feel we did very well to choose the HGH. We initially booked an 'inside' room because I'm fussy about noise. It looked a little dull and we upgraded to a room overlooking Pantheon Square. It was great to have such a lovely outlook and the noise level was perfectly tolerable.
reviews.title: Great place to stay
Relaxed stay at the Grands Hommes
reviews.text: The Hotel is well placed for trips all over town - but we must have walked at least 10K on one day alone!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: The room was a little on the small side but everything was in immaculate condition. The staff were perfectly friendly and hepful. There's little more you can say about a hotel as a base for a sight-seeing trip. I'd certainly recommend it.
reviews.title: Perfect Small French Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Richard Abrahams
reviews.title: Great location. Good value for money.

likes.disliked: — Slightly slow service at check-out time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very pleasant wee hotel at the side of the Pantheon. Nice, very clean room. Very helpful staff. There's a breakfast room in the basement which we didn't use- used a cafe down the street instead. They advertise a bar, but it's really just a couple of tables in the lobby, and they bring the drinks from next door.
reviews.title: Perfect

likes.liked: — Location, quiet and well put together!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I enjoyed an outstanding experience at the Hotel des Grands Hommes. Our room overlooked the Pantheon, a domed building housing the tombs of several famous people, including Marie Curie. The hotel's location was superb. It's in the Latin Quarter near the local university. There were several (at least 4) cafes on the same street as the hotel, as well as a few banks. Numerous cafes as well as a creperie lined the several blocks nearby. The hotel was just a block away from a metro stop and the Luxembuorg Gardens. I actually went on several morning jogs in the Gardens. It was also walking distance (between 15-20 minutes) from several quintessential Paris sites including Notre Dame, the Louvre, Musee D'Orsay and the Jardins de Tuilleries. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful, and spoke English, perhaps better than me. They graciously booked an excursion and unsolicited offered to arrange transportation to the airport. The room was large by Paris standards (short hallway led to room with double bed, tv, small couch and chair, and 2 closets). The room had a seperate water closet and bathroom with shower and sink. It was immaculate. The decor was quite charming. The hotel was a warm and friendly base for exploring the city. I would definitely recommend it to others and would stay there again.
reviews.title: Charming and Friendly Grand Hommes Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: A very nice little Hotel with friendly staff. The rooms are not so big but this is normal for Paris. Pretty view to the Pantheon. Metro and busses are very close to the hotel.
reviews.title: A perfect holiday in springtime

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a nice stay and we would booking this hotel once more.
reviews.title: Terrific hotel near the Pantheon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: This hotel is a great choice. The rooms and bathrooms are extremely large for Paris standards. The decor and room furnishings were of equisite taste and in excellent condition. The staff were kind and helpful. Being an American, I'm used to air conditioning and it would have been nice to have it on one hot day (a/c is not provided until the hottest months of the year). The hotel is literally feet from the Pantheon. We found that the best metro stop was the RER stop at Luxembourg (which is to say that the hotel is only a couple blocks from the Luxembourg gardens). That's the only other drawback -- that the metro isn't super close by. But, the area is safe and beautiful. Don't miss out on the Eglise St. Etienne du Mont. It's basically around the corner from the hotel. Check the hotel's website for great rates. And if you haven't stayed at the Hotel des Grands Hommes before, be sure to put it on your list for your next visit.
reviews.title: Can't wait to come back!

likes.disliked: — As is always the case, the rooms are a little smaller than in the states, but outs wasn't tiny.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We couldn't be more pleased with our stay at the Grande Hommes. The central location, charming room and pleasant staff far exceeded our expectations and we will be happy to stay there again when we return to Paris.
reviews.title: Valentines' Weekend in Paris

likes.disliked: — Room was small, but then we didn't go to Paris to sit in our room!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Just returned after staying for 3 nights at the Hotel Des Grands Homme. Hotel is excellent, clean, nicely decorated and staff are very helpful. Location is great 10 mins walk from Notre Dame and loads of cafes, bistros and restaurants a short walk from the hotel. Rooms were bigger than we expected (deluxe for wife and I, superior for our daughters), bathroom in deluxe rooms is good size and views of Pantheon were spectacular. Overall very impressed and would highly recommend.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: I stayed here for three nights at the start of a french holiday and taking the opportunity to visit friends in Paris. I had originally booked it as it was near where the friends lived, although they moved the weekend before I got there! However the location is quiet, parisien, just the right level of touristy, a stones throw from the lovelt luxembourg gardens and on the direct metro line from gare du nord for the eurostar.
reviews.title: Great hotel and location
Good option!
reviews.text: The picture 'room' by aj1809 is identical to my room, and all the pictures were very indicative of the hotel overall. The staff were helpful and understood my rusty french. The lift is slow particularly when the cleaners use it in the morning but the stairs down are fine not massive.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was clean, the TV had a small mixture of channels including BBC world. I can't remember if I specifically booked a bath but there was and it was good to rest my aching feet.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel in a fantastic location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definetly stay here again except for the fact that my mantra is try somewhere different but I think I will struggle for the price. I may try to look at the other hotels in the rive gauche hotel group
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in a fantastic location and the room we had was small (Paris usual) but beautiful.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: Breakfast was not to our liking as we are on a wheat/dairy free diet and there was nothing much we could eat, but if you can eat anything they had plenty to choose from.
reviews.title: Very good hotel, amazing blog

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were very helpful and we would go back again.
reviews.title: Loved this Hotel!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed quite a while ago at this hotel at a discount which made it great value for money. Rooms are nicely decorated and bathroom was impeccable. Staff was very friendly and not intrusive.
reviews.title: Friendly Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've visited Paris several times over the last few years and have come to love the Latin Quarter area. This was our first stay in Hotel des Grand Hommes and we were very impressed by the quality of service and standard of accommodation; it certainly lived up to all of our expectations (and it is now a hot favourite for a future visit). Our room (number 52) was an absolute delight, with a fantastic view...
reviews.title: April in Paris - The Best One Yet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel itself has a cosmopolitan ambience, and the staff are very accommodating and efficient in their dealings with all who stay there. It is very close to everything that you are likely to need, yet the immediate area has a very quiet and laid back feel to it, especially in the evenings.
reviews.title: A delightful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whilst the hotel doesn't provide full bar facilities, we were delighted to find a great traditional cafe just around the corner - ideal for combining nightcaps with a bit of people-watching !!
reviews.title: Great Place, Great Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Last stayed (in fact next door, at the Pantheon), some five years ago and the same excellent service, decor and attention to detail continue. The location is ideal for getting to everywhere you want to be, and the comfortable rooms a real pleasure to get back to after a long day. Will not hesitate to stay again and will recommend to others.
reviews.title: First rate
Great stay at Grandes Hommes
reviews.text: Lovely small hotel in a great location. Rooms were small but well appointed. Staff extremely helpful. Would definitely return.

reviews.title: Paris in style!
reviews.text: Absolutely marvelous experience. Very witty decoration, lovely old-style sunny bathroom, excellent location. A real delight!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I realy liked this hotel. It was in good walking distance from many interesting places like Notre Dame and Louvre. Also many resturants. We realy liked the resturants on a lively street near Notre Dame - you´ll find it when you walked from the hotel down Boulevard St. Michel. The hotel is very old and charming. The room was small but nice and clean. The breakfast room was also nice - as the breakfast. The staff was healpfull and nice. The elevator was the smallest I´ve ever seen but I think that the elevators in Paris is all rather small. We loved Paris and when we go back - witch will be - I will surely book at this hotel again. Didn´t cost to much and was worth any penny!!!
reviews.title: I loved this hotel !

likes.liked: — Short walking distance to many interasting places

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: I just needed a one night stay before returning home. I wish I had stayed at this hotel my entire stay in Paris. On the down side the bed was not especially comfortable and it was typically tiny (by US standards) but big enough to move around in. Also, sound travels through the floors and walls but this wasn't a big problem because the clients of Grand Hommes seem a particularly quite bunch. The hotel made up for these minor issues because the staff was so polite, professional and helpful. This was really welcome because during my 10 day business stay in Europe I had encountered some hotel staff that ranged from "I really hate my job" to "I really hate you." The appointments in the bathroom were perfect and the entire place is impeccably decorated and clean, clean, clean! I had to check out before breakfast was served but the desk staff made me a nice cup of coffee gratis. I had the "superior room" and although it didn't face the Pantheon, it was on a quiet courtyard with double doors that opened onto a private little terrace with a cafe table and two chairs. Next time I'm in Paris, I would like to stay at Grand Hommes for pleasure - you can't get much more romantic - with the Pantheon across the street, a long view of the Effel Tower around the corner, and the Seine and Luxembourg Gardens just a stroll away. I wouldn't consider this a family/kid/teen kind of place, nor was it for the young and hip - but for the rest of us with a couple hunderd Euros to spend for a night's lodging I definately recommend it.
reviews.title: The Wonderful Concierge Service....
full of character
reviews.text: Stayed there in July of 2004 (a very belated review).

reviews.title: Perfect
reviews.text: This hotel is only a 3-star, and harbor no illusions - it's a 3-star hotel. However, in terms of style and character, it has more than some of the better ranked properties we've stayed in Paris.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had the mansarde room with view of the Pantheon. The room, while small, is tastefully decorated and has a large balcony with a great view. This is really what made our stay special. Had we stayed in a different room, our review would not have been as positive, as the public and private areas of the hotel are quite small.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely hotel, great location, small but charming rooms, staff very helpful, perfect for a sightseeing visit to Paris.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel experience

likes.liked: — Great location, superb housekeeping, professional and friendly staff.

reviews.title: A lovely hotel on the Left Bank
reviews.text: This was our first trip to Paris, so we were flying sort of blind (thanks Tripadvisor). I had been through briefly on business, so I knew we wanted to stay in the Latin quarter, but that was all. Hotel des Grands Hommes seemed to fit the bill, so we went for it. We couldn't have enjoyed it more.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After visiting Paris many many times in various locations (though mainly near the Invalides (as a keen Napoleonic scholar) I have to say that I can't imagine staying anywhere but the"Grands Hommes" in future trips.My wife and I loved it! Very pleasant,helpful staff,beautiful decor - looks more over the top in photo's than in real life!The best thing is it's situation,we went 2nd-5th May,a busy weekend and it was so peaceful.Despite some absurd reviews suggesting the walk from the RER station is akin to tackling Everest,it is in fact a 5minute walk up a gentle incline with the Jardins de Luxembourg behind you and The Pantheon ahead,wonderful views day or night.The hotel is to the right of the Pantheon as you walk up Rue Soufflot.Plenty of shops,restaurants and sights right outside the hotel- the Eiffel Tower lighting up like fireworks every hour on the hour at night.Great hotel,great location. Mike -Leeds UK.
reviews.title: Perfect for Paris in Spring!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Traveled to Paris with husband and 3 children. The stay at the Hotel des Grands Hommes was a high light. The rooms reflected the atmosphere of Paris. The view on the Pantheon was to die for.
reviews.title: Family in France
wonderful experience!
reviews.text: We loved Hotel des Grands Hommes. The location was excellent, there were plenty of restaurants and cafes nearby and there's a couple of convenient metro stops too. The staff was extremely helpful and accomodating, and our room looking over the Pantheon was terrific. We will return!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on our honeymoon and it couldn't have been better. The staff were all very helpful. Location was great - very central with view of the Pantheon from our bedroom. The room was pretty small but c'est la vie for a hotel in the middle of Paris. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Great location, great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed here for 2 nights in april. hotel was lovely. nice friendly front desk. stayed in room 12 over looking the pantheon. bathroom clean and spacious. sofa area in bedroom and bed large and comfortable. enough storage. down side was at night you could hear traffic noise over the cobbles outside and in the early morning you are woken by the sound of road sweepers!!! but this aside i would stay here again. beautiful decor. didn't have breakfast as we were out and about early. plenty of cafes, bars and restaurants nearby. we went to the moulin rouge which was a good experience, went down very well with my husband!!! book before you go. metro excellent way to travel as taxis can be slow and expensive. all in all lovely stay made more special by this lovely hotel.
reviews.title: beautiful setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was great (facing the Pantheon, close to the Metro) and the staff was very friendly and helpful. We'll stay again nexy time we're in Paris. The only minor negative is that the rooms are awfully small (huge beds make it even worse). You can pay more and get larger rooms so that may be a good option. All in all we had a great stay and recommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Staff, Rooms a little Small (but hey, it's Paris)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I found the Hotel des Grands Hommes quite nice and would certainly stay again upon our next trip to Paris. The staff was very helpful and friendly, we didn't experience the food as we were on the move our entire four day stay and the room was comfortable clean. The location is in a great spot especially if you enjoy walking to explore the city, there was so much within a few blocks.
reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel des Grands Hommes almost 2 years ago now, and investigated the possibility of returning when we visit Paris again next year, however, the prices have gone up quite a lot and given the Aussie dollar against the Euro, it's now out of our price range. However, when we stayed there, we were thrilled with the hotel. The room (standard double) was minute, but as it was so beautifully decorated, the size didn't bother us at all. The bathroom was fabulous. Breakfast was included in the price and it was simple but delicious although it was served in a room so small that one could easily feel claustrophobic. Location was great, rooms were very clean and it was pretty quiet at night. Fabulous hotel. If the Aussie dollar ever improves, we will definitely return.
reviews.title: Wish we could afford to go back.

likes.liked: — Good location and beautifully decorated rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: An exceptionally lovely place to stay in Paris. Helpful, kind staff, clean, charming rooms at a superb location. We stayed for 4 nights, it was a great experience for the whole lenght of our stay.
reviews.title: The perfect choice
An enjoyable stay
reviews.text: We had a short stay in the Hotel des Grands Hommes (2 nights), but it was enough to know that finally we have found in Paris a good, clean, quiet hotel, situated in an ideal location. The area itself is not so quiet during the day, but the at night time it is. Arriving to Paris from Brussels by train, it is very easy to take the RER line to Luxembourg station, the closest one to the hotel. We felt privileged to have a room with a view to the Pantheon. The staff were friendly and attended to all our requests for assistance. The area is full of small brasseries and it was very pleasant to walk to the Jardins de Luxembourg. We will definitely return and have no hesitation in recommending it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Nice hotel in a very good location, staff very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had feared the worst re room size after reading reviews of other Paris hotels, but these were fine. Beautifully decorated with roomy and spotlessly clean bathrooms. I would definitely stay here again
reviews.title: Loved Les Grand Hommes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008
reviews.text: We just have just arrived back from Paris yesterday and I wanted to immediately write a review about the Hotel des Grandes Hommes! The hotel's location is perfect, it is within walking distance of most of the major museums and tourist sights! Also it is just three blocks away from a Metro/RER station. The hotel is beautifully located directly across the street from the Pantheon and is surrounded by a safe area with great local restaurants. Most importantly the staff is amazing, in the months prior to my stay, they made all of my reservations for restaurants, set up my shuttle to and from the airport, and set up and recommended excellent tours. In particular, Romain, was an great help. They are friendly, knowledgeable and professional. In addition, they make you feel at home. The hotel is spotless clean and the breakfast in the morning was just perfect. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who visits Paris! You will not be disappointed!
reviews.title: Exceptional!!!

likes.liked: — The location, it was clean, and the staff was exceptional.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We’ve been at the Hotel des Grands Hommes for a weekend recently and enjoyed it from beginning to the end. Location is, as many others have pointed out, excellent. Right at the Pantheon, a short walk from the RER Louxembourg station (make sure you don’t get off the station at the exit “Rue de l’Abbé de l’Epée”, it might be a bit confusing).
reviews.title: Deserves its good rating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Staff were very friendly and helpful, breakfast was very good and served in the small cellar (cozy). The standard room was small but absolutely sufficient and nicely decorated; very nice bathroom, well equipped. There was also a balcony to the rear.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Staff and Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Because the Sorbonne is nearby, there are many students around at that time of the year which makes the area very lively, also at night. Noise was no problem, though you could hear from the distance some people having a good time. The HGH is a definitive recommendation and a place to return to.
reviews.title: quiet, great location, lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow - per all reviewers, the location is fantastic with a view of the impressive Pantheon. We were upgraded to a superior room with a view and while I can't comment on comparisons for other Paris hotels, we were very comfortable (2 big pieces of luggage) with a good size bathroom and shower. Even though the Pantheon square sometimes was busy with traffic, the room was insulated well enough where we hardly noticed any noise, so we slept very well. The wireless internet connection in our room came in very handy.
reviews.title: Just superb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed at Hotel des Grands Hommes for a week in late June. The rooms were reasonably sized (for Paris), and in good condition. The style of the decor is from another century, which was not to my taste (though it was well done). The staff were courteous and helpful when responding to a request to change rooms. The second room had a balcony facing into the small interior courtyard, which was very nice.
reviews.title: Enjoyed my stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel is in the Place du Pantheon, close to the RER B line (which goes straight to Charles de Gaulle airport), and Luxembourg garden.
reviews.title: great hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend the hotel without reservation to anyone who is looking for a comfortable, tasteful place, but doesn't need a luxury hotel experience (i.e. lots of staff, and overpriced service charges for everything).
reviews.title: True to their word

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location and is literally next door to the Pantheon! The first day we walked to all of the major sites; second day we were a bit tired so we took the metro that is about a 5 minute walk from the hotel. The metro is very easy to use, but keep in mind that is stops running around midnight. The room was very clean and a good size, with a comfortable bed that slept two. The bathroom was surprisingly huge! The reception was very helpful and gave us excellent directions and advice. THe hotel is near many cafes and a couple souvenier shops. My friend and I (women in late 20s) felt safe walking around this area at night. I would recommend this hotel and would definitely return myself.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel! Great location! Terrific staff! Highly Recommend!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Grande Hommes was very well placed in Paris. The rooms although small were very clean and well appointed and quiet. The price on the web-site was cheaper to that advertised in the rooms and they remained true to their word. The service was very good. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Gorgeous hotel Next to the Awe Inspiring Pantheon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A beautiful hotel with excellent serivce and unbeatable location. The area managed to be quiet and relaxing while still being very near great sites and transportation options. Many charming little neighborhoods to explore in the area, but easy to get to where the action is. The staff was very friendly and helpful (my dress strap broke as we were getting into the cab for New Year's Eve, and the desk attendant sewed it up and sent me off with a little sewing pack).
reviews.title: Everything but the beds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We were promised a room with a Pantheon view but got one with a terrace in the back -- although I decided not to complain as we thought that might be more quiet and private. Had the weather been nice, we would have prefered the little terrace anyways. My other main complaint is the beds -- they were hard as a ROCK. And the pillows were the opposite, way too soft and fluffy. As much as I loved the hotel, my husband and I were in great pain and discomfort after 5 nights on those awful beds -- and as much as we really enjoyed the hotel, if the beds are all like that, we couldn't come back. I would have given 5 stars otherwise...
reviews.title: A Grand Hotel

likes.disliked: — Chambre 60 has a large balcony with spectacular views of Pantheon and Sacre Coeur

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel does not disappoint! This was my second visit and I remained impressed by the spectacular views, helpful staff, charming atmosphere and beautifully decorated rooms. The location of the hotel is excellent for hoping on and off the metro/RER and is in walking distance to many museums and attractions. Latin Quarter restaurants are only a short stroll away.
reviews.title: Fantastic Find!!
A Short Stay in Paris!
reviews.text: We spent 3 wonderful nights at the Hotel des Grands Hommes in mid-November.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room (no 1) was huge - with a sitting area and large bathroom and lots of storage. Situated on the ground-floor it looked right onto the Pantheon - breathtaking!
reviews.title: Great Hotel, perfect location

likes.liked: — Individual decor - felt like a boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a return visit as we enjoyed our first stay so much. The rooms are comfortable although compact and the location is excellent. It's worth requesting a front room as it's glorious to wake up to the Pantheon right outside the window. People watching is great value with the Sorbonne being so close.The staff are unfailingly helpful and courteous and although we didn't have breakfast there once on our first visit, we took it there almost every morning of our second visit. It was a lot cheaper and more substantial than in a cafe and the waitress was wonderful. There are plenty of good local restaurants within easy strolling distance and the Musee de Moyen Age is close by and well worth a visit to see the beautiful Lady and the Unicorn Tapestries. We will be happy to go back again on our next visit to Paris.
reviews.title: Return Visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very friendly and helpful staff.
reviews.title: Excellent
Charming Hotel in downtown Paris
reviews.text: Room very clean and fairly spacious.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Fantastic Location.
reviews.title: Loved Hotel Grands Hommes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Hope to go again!
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel
Fantastic Hotel, Great Location and Nice Staff
reviews.text: We stayed here for a 4 night break in late Feb. Hotel was great - we booked a standard room but requested a view if possible (most standard rooms are at the back and don't get the view of the Pantheon). Received an email saying a superior room was available for extra which we declined. When we arrived we were put in an amazing room - with wonderful parisian decoration, double french doors overlooking the Pantheon and square - fabulous. We were charged the amount we agreed (standard rate) and had an brilliant 5 days. Watched Wales loose in the rugby, did all the usual sight seeing - the metro is so good compared to the UK - short walk to the stops which take you anyway (buy a 10 book ticket). A gentle walk down to the Jardin du Luxembourg for a stroll, restuarants, shops in close proximity - just great. Suggest you buy a museum ticket as you can advance queues - saying that only Musee D'Orsay had a significant queue - the others were short.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff couldn't have been more helpful.
reviews.title: Service, style and location
An excellent choice
reviews.text: Would recommend it! Have fun.

reviews.title: Lovely Hotel
reviews.text: Hotel des Grandes Hommes is very welcoming, stylish, clean and perfectly located opposite the Pantheon in the Latin Quarter. The staff are fully at your service, and it is so tranquil that you would think there was no one else in the hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Book well in advance!
reviews.title: very comfortable & a good location
Grands Hommes Encore
reviews.text: When visiting Paris, Grands Hommes is the hotel I select first, and I'm disappointed when its fully booked. The location opposite the Pantheon is one of the best in Paris, and it's easy to walk to other famous places. The decor is stylish and the hotel is quiet. Ideal.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed here for three nights in December 2006. A lovely hotel which is very well situated in the Latin Quarter, a short walk from Notre Dame, and near to many restaurants in St Germain des Pres. No complaints at all and would happily stay here again.
reviews.title: perfectly located hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently spent 4 nights in this hotel and I would highly recommend it. It is in a great location, near some nice bistros and just 10 minutes walk to notre dame (and all downhill!!!). Although just one metro stop from the lively centre of Paris the surrounding area is very peaceful and relaxing. The rooms were clean and the decor was fantastic.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from 3 nights in Paris and the Hotel des Grands Hommes. The trip was a surprise for my wifes birthday so I wanted everything to be perfect....and it was (relief !) The hotel is in a great location in the 5th Arr and a gentle stroll from the train station RER Line B - direct to CDG airport. It has plenty of restaurants and shops nearby and an easy downhill stroll to Notre Dame. Our room was compact but spotlessly clean and very well presented. The decor was very warm and romantic - which followed throughout the hotel - a very cozy and homely feel to the place. We had breakfast included which offered good choice and there was plenty of it to keep you going for the day. All in all a place I would defintely reccommend without hesitation.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel in Great Location with Lovely Staff
